message.content:
cs.LO, cs.AI, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL

This paper presents a new framework for reasoning about linear temporal logic (LTL) using propositional satisfiability (SAT) solving. Therefore, it is likely to be categorized under cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), as these sub-categories deal with formal reasoning and automated reasoning, respectively. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of SMT solvers, which are commonly used in program verification and software engineering, suggesting that it could also be categorized under cs.PL (Programming Languages) and cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper deals with LTL, which is a formal language used to specify temporal properties of systems, indicating that it could also be categorized under cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory).
